section1.title: Building Together
section1.description: Did you build something cool? Share it with the world! Look for related projects to integrate your work, or start a new open-source project.

section2.title: Bringing the community together
section2.description: We believe collaboration sparks the best ideas. That's why we host regular meetups for our sports analytics community. Join us to connect, learn from experts, and share your insights and projects.

section3.title: Bringing sports together
section3.description: Our vision emphasizes collaboration across all sports. We believe in the power of working together to drive cross-sport innovation, applying solutions from one sport to another to maximize impact.

mission.title: Our mission
mission.quote: UNITE PRACTITIONERS RESEARCHERS LEARNERS ENTHUSIASTS TO SHARE INDUSTRY BEST PRACTICES AND EXCHANGE IDEAS TO ADVANCE OPEN-SOURCE SPORTS ANALYTICS COMMUNITY

nonProfit.title: Non Profit
nonProfit.description: Support adoption, (paid) development, maintenance and improving documentation of open-source sports analytics packages.

meetups.title: Meetups & conferences
meetups.description: Interested in organising a meetup or hosting a PySport conference?

koenVossen.name: Koen Vossen
koenVossen.title: Founder & President of PySport
koenVossen.description: Co-Founder & CTO at TeamTV. Kloppy Maintainer. Head-coach of a Korfball team.

koenRaad.name: Koen de Raad
koenRaad.title: Treasurer at PySport
koenRaad.description: Co-Founder at Eyedle & SPADE. PyData Organiser.

jorisBekkers.name: Joris Bekkers
jorisBekkers.title: Secretary at PySport
jorisBekkers.description: Sports Analytics Consultant. Start-up Advisor at UnravelSports. Data Analytics at U.S. Soccer Federation.

footer.helpMessage: If you want to help us reach our goals, either by donating, hosting a meetup or contributing please reach out to us!
footer.visionMessage: Our vision doesn’t say anything about a type of sports. That’s by intention. We believe we should keep looking for opportunities to apply a solution from sport A to sport B. When we start being creative and think about how to apply solutions from one sport to another the impact of those innovations is way bigger. As a result the audience is bigger and the chances are higher someone will come up with smart applications.
